column4: why doesn't canonical start shipping computers with ubuntu preloaded?  Right now i'm pretty sure their business model involves taking massive losses on this whole paying for open source development thing
I think Canonical would prefer to get /other/ people to ship Ubuntu preloaded and pick up the support revenue
yes, there has been alot of money gone into Ubuntu, Launchpad and the tools
hrm, but they've got the power to bulk buy, and as we know from system76 its going to take real bulk buys to even MATCH the prices you can get on computers preloaded with windows
